intro: Selago ceciliae, commonly known as the Cecilia's starflower, is a rare and delicate plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family, characterized by its bell-shaped flowers. The plant features small, star-like white or pale blue flowers that bloom in early spring. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, adapted to withstand cold and arid conditions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Selago ceciliae is considered a species of conservation concern.
